bestBHT.bht: The disciples and the Spirit bear witness together, as the Holy Ghost works in and through them. The historical witness given by the ministers and eye-witnesses of the word, summarized in the Gospels, emphasizes this unity. Christians, like the disciples, have ample opportunities to prepare for their role as witnesses through their present opportunities for acquiring qualifications. Filled with and taught by the Holy Spirit, they can bear faithful testimony to what they have seen and heard, just as the disciples, who were chosen to be with Christ from the beginning.

This verse alludes to the historical witness which the Holy Ghost in the ministers and eye-witnesses of the word... OF WHICH OUR INSPIRED GOSPELS ARE THE SUMMARY.
But both the one and the other are given by the self-same SPIRIT;—neither of them inconsistent with, or superseding the other.

From his entrance on the public work of the ministry, Matthew 4:17-22. Compare Acts 1:21-22.
Marvin Vincent: Shall bear witness [μαρτυρειτε] . Present tense, bear witness. So Rev. Or, it may be taken as imperative : bear ye witness.

...to inform us that so much the greater credit is due to the apostles on this ground, that they were eye-witnesses of what they relate.

bhtAttempts.bht: The witness of the disciples and the Spirit are one and the same, as the Holy Ghost works through them to testify to the truth. The verse alludes to the historical witness provided by the ministers and eye-witnesses of the word, as summarized in the inspired Gospels. The disciples were chosen to be with Christ and had ample opportunities to acquire their qualifications for the great office of bearing witness. Today, Christians must also bear witness when filled with and taught by the Holy Spirit, although this is where they often fail. The disciples were not only able to testify to what they had seen and heard, but also to what they experienced with Christ from the beginning.

The witness of the disciples and the Spirit are one and the same, as the Holy Ghost works through them to testify to the truth. The inspired Gospels serve as a summary of the historical witness provided by the ministers and eye-witnesses of the word. Christians must bear witness when filled with and taught by the Holy Spirit, as the disciples were chosen to be with Christ and had ample opportunities to acquire their qualifications for this great office. They were able to testify to what they had seen, heard, and experienced from the beginning of their journey with Him.

The disciples, having been chosen to be with Christ from the beginning, were able to bear faithful testimony to all they had seen, heard, and experienced.
